description:
8.109 sofalizer
SOFAlizer uses head-related transfer functions (HRTFs) to create virtual
loudspeakers around the user for binaural listening via headphones (audio
formats up to 9 channels supported).
The HRTFs are stored in SOFA files (see http://www.sofacoustics.org/ for a database).
SOFAlizer is developed at the Acoustics Research Institute (ARI) of the
Austrian Academy of Sciences.

To enable compilation of this filter you need to configure FFmpeg with
--enable-libmysofa.

The filter accepts the following options:

anglestep.description: Set neighbor search angle step. Only used if option 'interpolate' is enabled.

elevation.description: Set elevation of virtual speakers in deg. Default is 0.

framesize.description: Set custom frame size in number of samples. Default is 1024. Allowed range is from 1024 to 96000. Only used if option 'type' is set to 'freq'.

gain.description: Set gain applied to audio. Value is in dB. Default is 0.

interpolate.description: Should nearest IRs be interpolated with neighbor IRs if exact position does not match. By default is disabled.

lfegain.description: Set custom gain for LFE channels. Value is in dB. Default is 0.

minphase.description: Minphase all IRs upon loading of SOFA file. By default is disabled.

normalize.description: Should all IRs be normalized upon importing SOFA file. By default is enabled.

radius.description: Set distance in meters between loudspeakers and the listener with near-field HRTFs. Default is 1.

radstep.description: Set neighbor search radius step. Only used if option 'interpolate' is enabled.

rotation.description: Set rotation of virtual loudspeakers in deg. Default is 0.

sofa.description: Set the SOFA file used for rendering.

speakers.description: Set custom positions of virtual loudspeakers. Syntax for this option is: <CH> <AZIM> <ELEV>[|<CH> <AZIM> <ELEV>|...]. Each virtual loudspeaker is described with short channel name following with azimuth and elevation in degrees. Each virtual loudspeaker description is separated by '|'. For example to override front left and front right channel positions use: 'speakers=FL 45 15|FR 345 15'. Descriptions with unrecognised channel names are ignored.

type.description: Set processing type. Can be 'time' or 'freq'. 'time' is processing audio in time domain which is slow. 'freq' is processing audio in frequency domain which is fast. Default is 'freq'.
